title: At least 10 people killed after a boulder crashes on tourist boats in Brazil
description: At least five people were killed and 32 were injured after a boulder collapsed and fell on three boats in the Brazilian state of Minas Gerais on Saturday, Brazilian state media Agência Brasil reported.

title: How our ancestors used to sleep can help the sleep-deprived today
description: Like many people, historian A. Roger Ekirch thought that sleep was a biological constant -- that eight hours of rest a night never really varied over time and place.

title: Politico apologizes for their story about this photo
description: CNN's Oliver Darcy discusses Politico's correction after falsely reporting that Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor was dining with Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY).

title: Kazakhstan death toll spikes as 164 reported killed and thousands detained in violent protests
description: At least 164 people have been killed and more than 5,000 detained during violent upheaval in Kazakhstan this week, as unrest swept the nation and the death toll ticked even higher.

title: Rafael Nadal delighted with 'special' title win on return from injury
description: Former world No. 1 Rafael Nadal said his title win at the Melbourne Summer Set 1 on Sunday was one to cherish, as the Spaniard made a successful return to competition from a niggling foot injury that had kept him out for nearly four months.

title: Genevieve Beacom becomes first woman to pitch in the Australian Baseball League
description: History was made in Australia Friday as Genevieve Beacom became the first woman to pitch in the Australian Baseball League (ABL).

title: Blinken rules out pulling back US troops, restricting NATO in Russia talks
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken tells CNN's Jake Tapper that pulling some troops back from eastern Europe and refusing to allow Ukraine to join NATO are not on the table in negotiations with Russia this week.

title: 34 rescued from chunk of ice floating 1 mile off shore
description: At least 34 people were rescued on Saturday after being stranded on a large chunk of floating ice off the shore of Point Comfort on Green Bay, according to the Brown County Sheriff's Office in Wisconsin.

title: Uber driver pays for teen's hotel after winter storm stranded both
description: Trapped for hours on I-95 because of a winter storm, Uber driver Davante Williams helped book his teenage passenger a hotel room after her train trip was canceled and she couldn't get home.

title: Michelle Obama wades into 2022 midterm elections with urgent message on voting
description: Former first lady Michelle Obama has a message for Americans ahead of the 2022 midterm elections: "We've got to vote like the future of our democracy depends on it."

title: Baby handed to a soldier over airport wall during Afghanistan evacuation has been found
description: An infant boy handed in desperation to a soldier across an airport wall in the chaos of the American evacuation of Afghanistan has been found and was reunited with his relatives in Kabul on Saturday.

title: Reporter explains why Mitch McConnell isn't talking about Trump
description: Sen. Mitch McConnell (R-KY) spoke out forcefully about Trump's role in the insurrection during his impeachment trial. However, his statement on the anniversary of Jan. 6 didn't mention the former President. CNN reporter Eva McKend breaks down McConnell's strategy to deal with Trump.

title: Djokovic's case has gone far beyond an individual visa issue
description: For months, activists have gathered outside a rundown hotel in central Melbourne, calling for the dozens of refugees held inside to be freed.

title: Scientists name new tropical tree species after Leonardo DiCaprio
description: Leonardo DiCaprio has an Oscar, a BAFTA and three Golden Globe awards under his belt.

title: Man becomes first person in Colombia with non-terminal illness to die by legal euthanasia
description: Colombian Victor Escobar became the first person in the Andean country with a non-terminal illness to die by legally regulated euthanasia late on Friday, his lawyer Luis Giraldo confirmed.

title: US states are scrambling to keep up with an increase in Covid-19 hospitalizations
description: As a Covid-19 testing shortage compounds a burgeoning crisis of new hospitalizations, more states are racing to help hospitals and health care networks with staff and supplies.

title: Next week may see one of the most defining moments in relations between NATO and Russia since the break-up of the Soviet Union
NASA rocket launch puts on a show in the sky over the mid-Atlantic coast
description: Night owls on the mid-Atlantic coast were treated to a show in the sky overnight as a NASA rocket launched from the Wallops Flight Facility on Wallops Island, Virginia.

title: US man arrested for allegedly selling 'ghost guns'
description: A Rhode Island man was arrested in New York Thursday for allegedly selling or attempting to sell more than 100 guns that he produced at his home, according to the US Attorney's Office Southern District of New York.

title: The West has a rare window to put Putin in his place
Alec Baldwin says in Instagram video he is complying with cell phone search warrant
description: In a video posted on his Instagram account Saturday, Alec Baldwin said he was cooperating with authorities in their investigation into the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of the film "Rust," and any suggestion he is not complying with the search warrant issued for his cell phone is "a lie."

title: A good Samaritan died after trying to save a man who fell on the subway tracks in New York City
description: A good Samaritan died on New Year's Day while trying to help a man who fell onto subway tracks during a gang assault in New York City.

title: Hong Kong's free press is being 'gutted.' Here's what the world loses
description: In the past year, two of Hong Kong's biggest pro-democracy media outlets were toppled after enormous government pressure, a series of arrests and police raids on their newsrooms.

title: How the Duchess of Cambridge's style evolved from youthful sparkle to timeless elegance
description: Since joining the royal family in 2011, Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge -- known by many as Kate -- has rarely faltered on her unwritten obligation to appear manicured and immaculately dressed in the public eye. And while the duchess is renowned for her preppy tweeds and tailored blazers, she earned her true fashion credentials through a sharp eye for occasion wear.
